item.title: Cultural variation in response scales
item.description: paper-notes research-extradisciplinary research-culture Academic results RESPONSE STYLE AND CROSS-CULTURAL COMPARISONS OF RATING SCALES AMONG EAST ASIAN AND NORTH AMERICAN STUDENTS Responses to fifty-seven 7-point Likert-type scales were analyzed.

item.title: Cultural Conditioning or Placebo
item.description: paper-notes research-culture EMNLP 2024 from Monojit Choudhury and other MSRI people They condition prompts on “cultural and non-cultural cues” in order to test whether one’s variation is stronger than the others.

item.title: ChatGPT doesn't trust Chargers fans
item.description: ChatGPT Doesn’t Trust Chargers Fans from EMNLP 2024 They assess guardrail sensitivity, the overall tendency of the ChatGPT guardrail to refuse requests from some prompt topic across a bunch of different topics and demographic characteristics.

item.title: It's not the incentives
item.description: research-culture complaints blogpost-other Insightful blogpost from Tal Yarkoni Argues that it’s cowardly to do something unethical, antisocial, or harmful but then blame the incentive structures that reward it.

item.title: Available discoveries are a nonrenewable resource
item.description: Real science like physics has a limited amount of discoveries to be made sitting around Fake science assumes that there’s unlimited discoveries Multiconstraint optimization of benchmarks that are good/dynamic/construct valid (eg., chatbot arena) but NOT plug-and-play vs plug-and-play but not having ...

item.title: Get me off your fucking mailing list
item.description: complaints research-culture Self-explanatory, this is a real article that was published by David Mazieres and Eddie Kohler in the predatory open-access International Journal of Advanced Computer Technology.

item.title: Newuser command
